clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiac Strain Using Speckle Tracking Echocardiography During Orthotopic Liver Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Cardiac Strain Using Speckle Tracking Echocardiography During Orthotopic Liver Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are trying to improve the understanding of systolic function of the heart at the time of liver reperfusion in patients undergoing orthotopic liver transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Degree of change in cardiac strain
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 1 hour after graft reperfusion
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the degree of change to cardiac strain using speckle tracking echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Pattern of right and left ventricular strain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 hours from the time of surgery start
secondary_outcome.description: Describe the pattern of right and left ventricular strain throughout the course of orthotopic liver transplantion.

study_pop.textblock: Sequential liver transplant candidates (adults) will be approached for consent to participate in the study at the time of liver transplantation by a member of the liver anesthesia team.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age greater than 18 years
- Undergoing primary orthotopic liver transplantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Redo orthotopic transplantation
- Acute or fulminant liver failure
- Patient with pre-existing atrial fibrillation or hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
- Patients with an abnormal preoperative stress test (EF <55%, areas of prior infarct, ongoing ischemia)
